document.docAuthor: Simaiakis, Stylianos Michail, Akkari, Nesrine & Zapparoli, Marzio
document.masterDocTitle: The centipedes of Peloponnisos and first records of genus Eurygeophilus in the East Mediterranean (Myriapoda: Chilopoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The centipedes of Peloponnisos and first records of genus Eurygeophilus in the East Mediterranean (Myriapoda: Chilopoda)

subSubSection.paragraph:
( 2 )
B. affinis graeca
var. peloponnesiaca
Verhoeff, 1901
: 410
, 456.

( 5 )
B. affinis
subsp. graeca Verh.:
Attems, 1903 b
: 180 .

( 6 )
Bothriogaster signata Kessler
[sic!]:
Attems, 1926
: 238 , pl. XXVII, figs. 5–6 .

( 7 )
Bothriogaster signata
subsp. graeca Verb.:
Attems, 1926
: 239 , pl. XXVII; figs. 7–8 .

( 8 ) B . s . s . Att.:
Attems, 1929 a
: 48 .

( 9 )
B . s . graeca Verh.
:
Attems, 1929 a
: 49 , Fig. 78 .

General distribution. Europe: Albania , Bulgaria , Cyprus , FYR Macedonia , Greece (incl. Crete). West Asia: Caucasus, Iran , Iraq , Israel , Jordan , Palestine , Syria , Turkey , Saudi Arabia , Turkestan, Uzbekistan . North Africa: Egypt , Libya , Tunisia (
Zapparoli 2002
; Minelli et al. 2006 ).

Records in Peloponnisos (5, 9) (
Fig. 10
). Ahaia: Lapas (4, 11, 13 ); Patra (loc. typ. of
Bothriogaster affinis graeca
Verhoeff, 1901
) (1, 11, 13 ); Patra, near University (12, 13). Argolida: Argos, along Inachos river ( 13 ); Oros Artemissio, direction Karia, 1100–1400 m ( 13 ); Epidavros ( 13 ); Larissa fortress, near Argos (loc. typ. of
Bothriogaster affinis graeca
Verhoeff, 1901
) (1, 11, 13 ); Palamidi, near Nafplio (loc. typ. of
Bothriogaster affinis graeca
Verhoeff, 1901
and B. a. peloponnesiaca
Verhoeff, 1901
) (1, 2, 4, 11, 13 ); Tirintha (loc. typ. of
Bothriogaster affinis graeca
Verhoeff, 1901
and
B. a. naxia
Verhoeff, 1901
) (1, 3, 4, 7, 10, 11, 13 ). Arkadia: Tripoli (loc. typ. of
Bothriogaster affinis graeca
Verhoeff, 1901
, B. a. peloponnesiaca
Verhoeff, 1901
,
B. a. naxia
Verhoeff, 1901
) (1, 2, 3, 4, 11, 13); Leonidio, Paleohori ( 13 ); Levidi, Menalon Ski Resort ( 13 ); 1 km E Vitina, crossroads to Vitina, 1025 m ( 13 ). Ilia: Arhaia Olympia (6, 8, 10, 13); Amaliada, E Keramidia ( 13 ); Erimanthos, top, 1800 m ( 13 ); Erimanthos, top, 2200–2300 m ( 13 ); Lambia, N suburbs ( 13 ); Lambia, Chrisopigi ( 13 ); Oros Foloi, Lalas, 790 m ( 13 ). Korinthia: Oros Killini, 1500 m (12, 13). Lakonia: Githio ( 13 ); Mani, Vathia ( 13 ); Taigetos, near refuge, 1650–1700 m (12, 13). Messinia: Ithomi (loc. typ. of
Bothriogaster affinis naxia
Verhoeff, 1901
) (3, 11, 13 ); Kalamata, between Artemissia and Langada Pass ( 13 ); Parnonas, near Metamorfosi, Kalogerovouni, 1100 m ( 13 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10.
Himantarium gabrielis
(black circles) and
Bothriogaster signata
(green circles), distribution records in Peloponnisos.

New records from Peloponnisos (
Fig. 10
). 2 ♀♀ 132, 96 mm, 123, 123 lp, Argolida, Mt. Didimon (Ligourio), 600–1000 m ,
3 Jun. 2005
, G. Osella; 4 ♂♂ 93, 99, 99, 77 mm, 117, 117, 117, 113 lp;
1 ♂
juv. 70 mm , 117 lp, 1 ♀ 93 mm , 123 lp, Argolida, Mt. Didimon, 1000 m ,
20 May 2004
, G. Osella; 1 ♀, 105 lp, Arkadia, Mt. Menalon, Sky center, open habitats, 1600 m ,
4 May 2005
, G. Osella; 2 exx., Ilia, Neohori, 40 m ,
N 37.51792
/
E 21.61389
,
20 Apr. 2003
, P. Cerretti.

Ecological notes. 0–2300 m ; a thermophilous species, generally in
Quercus coccifera
scrubs, in
Quercus
sp. woods, in steppic habitats, in
Abies cephalonica
and
Pinus nigra
forest habitats, in Mediterranean phrygana; also in agroecosystems, in anthropized habitats, and in caves (
Verhoeff 1901
; Zapparoli 1994 , 1996 ,
2002
).
